channel.title: Major Security flaw found in Java 7
channel.description:
Apparently the US Homeland of Security has warned all businesses and people to stop using any kind of Java immediately and disable it Hackers have discovered a weakness in Java 7 security that could allow the installation of malicious software and malware on machines that could increase the chance of identity theft, or the unauthorized participation in a botnet that could bring down networks or be used to carry out denial-of-service attacks against Web sites.
[url=http://www.tancosin.com/Internet/major-java-7-security-flaw-us-department-of-homeland-security-intervenes/]http://www.tancosin.com/Internet/major-java-7-security-flaw-us-department-of-homeland-security-intervenes/[/url] Thers a vid on the site showing the exploit Thought i should warn you guys straight from villavu btw

item.title: Major Security flaw found in Java 7
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Doesn’t exist.

I’m talking about the newest patch they just released… It’s update 11 of Java 7.

Read full topic

item.title: Major Security flaw found in Java 7
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:14, topic:478216”]people have been saying for years not to allow java applets (or flash, or any other plugin) by default and this is why kiddie-winks

This is so old. People have known about it for like 3 months.

it’s a new exploit but just like the last exploit was patched immediately after[/quote]
Even with the jre 7.11 patch, the exploit still exists…

Read full topic

item.source: Major Security flaw found in Java 7

item.title: Major Security flaw found in Java 7
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:478216”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=596415.msg4200033#msg4200033 date=1358051097]

eyeownyew: They didn’t downloaded and run something, they just visited a webpage to activate the exploit.

If that was the case, why are they telling companies to stop using Java 7? Seems like a flawed argument to me. If a professional company was using it, they’d have no problem. The visitors would have the issue.

If they ran into some infected site they could be infected. For all we know, Taharok could have hidden a hidden java app into the site and controlling our computer.
[/quote]
Yes, but why are they telling companies to stop using it?.. It makes no sense, the argument is flawed[/quote]
Companies should get away from the flawed technology so their users don’t need Java installed.

Read full topic
item.source: Major Security flaw found in Java 7

item.title: Major Security flaw found in Java 7
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Oh look, another Java exploit. This can be a major problem when involving Flash.

Read full topic
item.source: Major Security flaw found in Java 7

item.title: Major Security flaw found in Java 7
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:478216”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=596415.msg4200033#msg4200033 date=1358051097]

eyeownyew: They didn’t downloaded and run something, they just visited a webpage to activate the exploit.

If that was the case, why are they telling companies to stop using Java 7? Seems like a flawed argument to me. If a professional company was using it, they’d have no problem. The visitors would have the issue.

If they ran into some infected site they could be infected. For all we know, Taharok could have hidden a hidden java app into the site and controlling our computer.
[/quote]
Yes, but why are they telling companies to stop using it?.. It makes no sense, the argument is flawed[/quote]

I guess they are worried that a group of determined hackers could potentially hack into the company’s websites and modify an existing java applet to attack potentially thousands more systems then would otherwise have been possible.

Its kind if a flawed reaction though because if somebody is willing to hack into a website the chances are they could just insert a modified java applet anyway to achieve the same affect.

Read full topic
